website_summaries.verdict: A meaty and healthy little heart-shaped training treat that any dog will happily chomp down in a hurry to hear your next command.
pros: Small and moist bites for all breeds
Great for dogs with food allergies
Includes Omega 3 for healthier skin and coat
cons: Select another variety if your puppy can’t handle poultry

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Treats
customer_reviews.text: I feed my dog Blue Buffalo food, so I decided to give these a try. My dog doesn’t like their hard treats, but loves these! They are very small but great training treats (and are heart shaped...so cute!). I keep them by the door for when she rings the bell, goes outside, then goes potty. I also bring them in a bag when we go on a walk to train her when we see other people/dogs, as she is a rescue and is scared of other people and animals. Very pleased with these. A brand I trust and nice size treats that my dog is motivated by!
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Tasty treats for training man's best friend!
customer_reviews.text: We have a puppy that we have been training and she absolutely loves these treats. They are her favorite ones and I use them for when she tends to be more hesitant to want to do something. The treats aren't too moist and one meatball can easily be broken up into several pieces. They have a good smell so I use them for nose work (training to find things by scent). I like them because they don't contain corn, wheat, or soy. They also have no chicken or poultry byproduct meals. There's no artificial preservatives, colors, or flavors.
customer_reviews.author: KSERI

customer_reviews.title: "Bits" is the keyword here---these are very small nuggets
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use as training treats, where I need something small and chewy instead of crunchy and crumbly. My dog seems to like the taste, but the treats are sized too small for him (he's an XL doggy)---when I hold out a nugget, he either swallows it whole or knocks it out of my hand trying to find it. Probably just right for smaller dogs.
customer_reviews.author: LegoGirl

customer_reviews.title: My dog LOVES these treats
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats, she's a Blue Bit-aholic. She's even learned the words "Blue Bits" means "Treats." My dog has a sensitive stomach and most treats upset her stomach. Blue Bits never upset her stomach which is awesome. I'd recommend purchasing Blue Bits b/c all dogs seem to love them, and from my personal experience especially if your dog has a sensitive stomach. The seller is good, they always arrive fresh and on time. 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: I love that I found a value size bag for a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've got a picky Chihuahua. She's tried all flavored of these heart size bites and chicken is the only flavor she likes. I love that I found a value size bag for a decent prize.
customer_reviews.author: LUCLUTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Recall on these.. LED poisoning! Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Well had to throw away and scared for my pup because there is a recall on these. They put led inside these treats and now they are poisoning dogs all over. Will not be buying blue buffilo anymore.
customer_reviews.author: forrest gates

customer_reviews.title: Not a lot but pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: My Dane puppy loves them, my chihuahua pup, not so much. Big guy isn't a picky eater, he's always down for a milkbone. Little guy is the pickiest eater in the house, won't eat a treat unless it's made with real meat and is soft. My little guy liked it at first but now he just spits it out and let's the big guy clean it up. The bag is so little though, my Dane puppy could devour the whole thing in a few minutes if I let him. For big dogs, it's not too worth it since you get so little, but for little dogs that aren't as picky as mine, it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you check your bag expiration date. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you check your bag expiration date. I found it unusual that my dachshund refused to eat this item when it arrived because SHE LOVES BLUE BITS. Her behavior made sense once I realized that the item was expired and the bits had an odd texture. The exp. date was 2/13/18 and I received the item well towards the end of March 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal

customer_reviews.title: He’d do a spontaneous back flip if he could
customer_reviews.text: My ten pound terrier has been known to go through his entire repertoire of tricks non stop when he sees I reach for a bag. I was introduced to them by a dog trainer & use them for obedience, rally, and trick training. I keep at least two bags of Blue Bits open (different flavors so he doesn’t get tired of the same old flavor every day) and rotate thru all the flavors. If I’m training for awhile, I cut them into smaller pieces to avoid over feeding him. He doesn’t seem to notice the difference. Cutting bits is not advised for a bait bag as they crumble once cut.
customer_reviews.author: mspscruz

customer_reviews.title: Great Treats For Puppy Training
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loved these treats. They are the perfect size for puppy training. They are also the right amount of soft and the right amount of firm for their chewing. When training a puppy you want something that won't take him too long to eat so he can refocus on the training. They smell like beef and i think that gets their attention. The smell is strong but not offensive strong. My puppy loved them. They are about the size of a dime and in heart shaped which is cute. Your dog will love them.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Siguenza

customer_reviews.title: Great treats!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats and they are perfectly sized for treat training. I store them in small glass jars (Glass Baby Food Storage Containers - Set contains 4 Small Reusable 4oz Jars with Airtight Lids - Safely Freeze your Homemade Baby Food]]) and put them throughout the house so I can give my dog small treats for good behaviors. They do smell a bit (which is why I use the glass jars) but it's not overwhelming and my dog loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Liked by senior dogs and puppies
customer_reviews.text: Both my dogs love these (one a senior who's had the good tasting but not good for him treats, and one a puppy new from the breeder who's only use to high quality food). They're tiny enough for training a puppy and moist enough that she could eat them somewhat quickly. The smell is potent, which is great for dogs, and reminded me of bacon so I didn't mind. I very much recommend these treats.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Dogs wouldn’t touch treats from the 16-oz bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 4-oz package & my dogs loved them, so I bought the 16-oz package of the same flavor thinking they would be the same treat. Well, they weren’t. My dogs wouldn’t touch the treats from the 16-oz bag. I tossed some on the floor & the dogs just left them there, something that has never happened. There must have been something off about them for the dogs to react that way, so I tossed the bag in the trash & decided to steer clear of Blue Buffalo from now on.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Pup loves these!
customer_reviews.text: These little treats are a must if you are trying to train your pup. They are tasty and my pup will do anything for these treats. Best results for house training I have found. She goes out and get a treat after doing her business. Now she sits at door and whines to go out. Haven't used a pee pad in 2 weeks. She is only 12 weeks old. Glad I found these treats!!
customer_reviews.author: EJR

customer_reviews.title: Flavor has changed!?
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, got the new packaging on 12/19, and our Pet no-longer will eat? She's been eating these beef treats for 10-years and loving them, but at the same time the package changed, so must of the flavor/ingredients, REAL Shame,...Pets know the diff? Why do companies have to fix whats not broken,..in this case, it must be cost savings I'd have to guess? So to probably save cost, they've LOST many customers, not a profit making move, WAS IT? Remember the NEW revised Coca-Cola flavor debacle back then, Sheesh...people Never learn, RIGHT!?
customer_reviews.author: Grousserr

customer_reviews.title: The best dog treats
customer_reviews.text: My dog trainer highly recommended this product and both my dogs love them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mathers

customer_reviews.title: Training treats dogs love.
customer_reviews.text: Nice big bag of training treats for the dog. I purchased the smaller bags at pet stores and our dog loves them. He gets the treats as a reward for doing different things. It was nice to see Amazon had them in an economical 16 oz. Bag. We get them on auto delivery as they are at an excellent price. They come in a couple of flavors but our dog prefers the beef. Each treat is about 4 calories so this won't hinder their diet at all. Highly recommend these training treats to people looking for a nice low calorie reward.
customer_reviews.author: Rich W

customer_reviews.title: Only 3 1/2 calories and our 40# dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: We need to watch the weight of our dog. This little 3 1/2 calorie treat keeps her happy We only give her 4 a day and only one at a time. One 1/2 way thru our morning walk, one when we get home from the walk. The other two vary. One might be when she is being especially good. Or maybe one just to let her know we love her.
customer_reviews.author: K. K. Shim

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money on a product too hard for your dog to chew.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this before and it was fine. My dog loves this treat. It came from PetSmart and was as hard as a rock. My dog wouldn’t even put one in her mouth. When I picked it up I quickly picked up the other three and opened the entire bad. She could have chipped a tooth they were so hard. I threw money away on a product that she lives. During these times even my dog needs a little treat, but not pebbles. Don’t buy if it’s coming from PetSmart. Find another treat through Chewy or another supplier.
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Cohn

customer_reviews.title: Pup loves them - but don’t let them dry out!
customer_reviews.text: My pup LOVES these! We have three different types of treats, but these are her favorite! My only gripe is that these are treats that need to stay “fresh” - if you don’t leave them in the resealable bag, they dry out and become really hard for the pup to eat.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: My Boston loves these
customer_reviews.text: My Boston Terrier loves these little training treats. It’s almost like they stick to the top of his mouth or something though because he sits there and smacks his mouth for a minute or so after he eats one. If you want a quick reward and need to move on from that quickly, (for extended training sessions) this might not be the best item for your needs. The way I use it, rewarding a single trick or behavior and then ending the session, it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D.

customer_reviews.title: Best Value for An Amazing Treat
customer_reviews.text: I've got a 5 months old lab puppy and she absolutely loves these treats. They've got a very strong smoked smell very reminiscent of beef jerky (if you didn't know better, you'd think its just beef jerky). It is definitely my dog's favorite treat. They are relatively expensive and this is the best price I've found anywhere so I highly recommend getting it in bulk here.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Tan

customer_reviews.title: Nice dog treatss for the health conscious owner
customer_reviews.text: I got the 4oz chicken bits dog treats. There were 85 little soft, chewy, heart shaped snacks in the bag. All my dogs ate them first try and seemed to enjoy them, even the two picky ones. The little hearts are slightly smaller than a dime and just big enough to break in two. I break them in half for my tiny 4 lb dog so she doesn't just fill up on dog snacks.
customer_reviews.author: K.C. Kuntz

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves these, now if i were a better trainer...
customer_reviews.text: My 3 month old pup loves these. They last an amazingly long time if you break up the bits smaller for pups. A small bag lasted me a couple weeks of heavy potty training and other "attempts" at training. I got another bag of treats that she would not touch, which was surprising because she seems willing to taste and eat anything. She always seems excited to have Blue treats. I was so impressed i ordered a variety pack and another order of the chicken.
customer_reviews.author: BuzzlitebeerTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small treat for training and rewarding!
customer_reviews.text: I love that these have more limited and recognizable ingredients. The size make these excellent for training. While they are not as soft as I expected, our Ziggy doesn't seem to mind. He comes running the minute he smells them or hears the bag. It looks like we have finally found a chicken free treat that works!
customer_reviews.author: Books, Vertigo and Tea

customer_reviews.title: What a great product
customer_reviews.text: These treats get the credit for teaching my puppy house trained. I fill up an old pill bottle with them so I always have some in my pocket. That way they don't get dried out and hard. My puppy has a hard time controlling himself when he gets a smell of these. He likes them more than any other treat I have found. I like the 1 pound bag which lasts for a long time. Very economical way to bribe your dog to good behavior.
customer_reviews.author: Big John

customer_reviews.title: Paw-rfect puppy treats
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 9 oz pack for my 10 week old puppy and she definitely loved these and allowed me to train her on basic commands fairly quickly as she would look forward to these treats after. Would've liked them being a little smaller, especially for puppies as one treat would be too much to offer at one time - I broke it into 3 pieces instead which made the puppy look forward to even more instead of feeling full with just one or two whole treats being given.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: Dogs are funny animals. They will enjoy things that we think are disgusting. I hate the smell of these treats, but my dog absolutely loves them so anything to make him happy right? :) We use these as potty treats every night. As soon as I say the word he's out the door, taking care of business, and running back in to get his 2 blue bits. Whatever works. I've been trusting Blue Buffalo and these appear to be a good healthy treat for him.
customer_reviews.author: R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves these!
customer_reviews.text: Either he loves the flavor of these or he prefers chewy treats. When I gave him these he started running around the office like a mad dog attempting to get more treats. Note that he's normally super calm and just lays there 20 hours a day. I've had issues with him eating his food, but I crumple three of these up and mix it in his food bowl and I haven't had any issues with him eating since. Very strong bbq smell so a little goes a long way when I sprinkle them on. They also crumble perfectly. Not too soft and not too dry.
customer_reviews.author: Kae Chen

customer_reviews.title: Dogs like them and they are healthy.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Blue Buffalo brand foods for all of my dog's lives. And, their treats offer the same quality as their foods: Good for my dogs, good for their health. My Yorkies are 18 and 15 years old (respectively). They are both strong and healthy - with ALL of their teeth. I attribute that to keeping them bathed, walked, well fed, and loved. Blue buffalo products are at the top of my list for that.
customer_reviews.author: Roger K. Mukai

customer_reviews.title: They are a good size for my retriever cause other treats are really ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog doesn't really care for other treats except this one! When my golden retriever sees me take this treat out, he listens to almost everything I say. They are a good size for my retriever cause other treats are really small like Zuke's or too bid like Old Mother Hubbard's. I definitely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Contains Crazy Puppy Hyper Sugar Buzz
customer_reviews.text: I saw another reviewer write about this but these contain Cane Sugar. We were wondering why our puppy was getting crazy hyper, clawing at the sofa and digging at everything she could fine. Since we switched to a different brand she no longer has these episodes (although not perfectly behaved yet :). I’d look at a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Deuce

customer_reviews.title: Good Snackies!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent treats. Decent Ingredients. We have a special trained 3-mutt testing team. They loved these treats, scarfing them down super fast. Chewbacca, our smallest tester, weighing in at a mighty 6 pounds does take his time with bigger snackies, but he loves them all.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff  🚑 & Jeff's Wife 💅Top Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: A healthy and delicious treat worthy of the price for your precious possession(s)!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two sizes of the "Blue Bits"; one a smaller Bit for training, and the larger Bit for a "Good for You" treat. Wow! Tulip and Tucker will do anything to earn one of these tasty bits, even steal them from the pantry if they knew how to open doors! :-) One of the BEST treats to match an earned reward I have ever purchased for the two. A happy dog, makes for a happy owner! Count us all HAPPY!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes both flavors we've tried.
customer_reviews.text: initially got some of the Blue Buffalo BLUE Bits Natural Soft-Moist Training Dog Treats in a monthly PupBox. we've tried the beef and the chicken, and Max, a smallish (16 lb) dog really likes them. The heart shape is kind of cute too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made my puppy sick!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy got diarrhea when I gave her these. I read reviews and they’re causing all kinds of problems with kidneys and needing vet care! I will never give these to my puppy again. They’re going in the trash. Total waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.author: MexicoBound

customer_reviews.title: Not Good
customer_reviews.text: Like many other reviews said my dogs love these treats usually but these are different. The ones you buy in store are softer and seem moist. These ones were very dry and crumbled like they were old. I checked the expiration date and it was still in the best used by time frame but I won't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: christopher_T

customer_reviews.title: No interest
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14 week old Havanese girl that I’ve had for almost 5 weeks. I bought these treats as a “welcome home” treat in both beef and chicken flavors. She loves her kibble, cheese, turkey hot dogs, and 5 other brands of treats but will not even take these in her mouth. I don’t know what the issue is, but the smell is not appealing to this puppy who is not overly fussy.
customer_reviews.author: BVH

customer_reviews.title: Helped us train our pup
customer_reviews.text: We had never heard of this brand before. We found it while perusing a store right after we brought home our puppy (Cavapoo). He liked them instantly, and we used them to train him for everything. We broke them into smaller pieces to make it last a little longer, but it worked. He's almost 2 now, and he still likes them as an occasional treat.
customer_reviews.author: Lizz + Michael

customer_reviews.title: Frenchie approved
customer_reviews.text: My frenchie loves these! I got her a treat dispensing ball and these to fill it. She's not picky but she really loves these. I specifically got these since she is on crate rest while recovering from spine surgery and cannot have too many exta calories. Each little heart is 2 calories! The ball I got her only holds about 12 but entertains her for at least 30 minutes in dog jail.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa

customer_reviews.title: My dog is addicted to these.
customer_reviews.text: We have a 16 year old Brussels Griphon named Lola. She gets what she wants and does what she wants. The only thing that gets her attention are these treats. No kidding my wife calls them doggie crack she loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Mark VandeKerckhove

customer_reviews.title: Perfect training treats
customer_reviews.text: My puppy loves these. They are small, but can easily be broken into three pieces or six without crumbling. They have a strong smell- which is great for training, playing "search", or teaching how to heel.
customer_reviews.author: Shay

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: I used these as a training treat and my dog pays a lot of attention to me when she know I have them. I do not give them to her unless training as this is her special treat for good behavior. She is still a Puppy. I personal would not feed as an everyday treat. So buy some and teach your dog some new tricks or just get them trained.
customer_reviews.author: StoryLover

customer_reviews.title: Happy puppy
customer_reviews.text: Purchase these training treats for my 9 week old Corgi puppy. I was hesitant because a lot of other treats looked very large and considering the small size of my dog I didn't want them to be much bigger than a pea. While these are slightly bigger than a pea, my puppy very much seem to enjoy them, and they are not overly large to be given multiple times a day. The soft chew is a very nice texture and has helped to make my training easier.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: A Favorite in Our House
customer_reviews.text: Our dog loves these. They are small enough that we can use them for training or stuffing food puzzles. They have a strong enough flavor that these count as high value treats for our dog. I have also used them while training dogs at the humane society and have found that most like these a lot. They are great to mix with kibble when stuffing kongs.
customer_reviews.author: Glenna

customer_reviews.title: Has grain in treats so makes puppy fart
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 8 week old puppy and she loved them. The only problem was that she was farting terribly and it smelled so bad. I realized there was grain in these treats and there is no grain in her food so it was causing her to fart. Make sure to check for grain in dog food before buying. But these were great training treats
customer_reviews.author: Bk

customer_reviews.title: My Dog's Favorite Treat
customer_reviews.text: These are my Cavachon's favorite treat, & she will always choose it first over any other treat offered. I've been purchasing Blue Bits BLUE training bites for over a year now, but I buy the larger bag at a good price at my local market.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Great obedience training treats
customer_reviews.text: I don't see these as "high-value" treats (for that I use Vital Essential niblets) but they're my favorite for everyday obedience competition dog training. Just the right size for my Labrador retrievers. For my pup, I break (or rather, bite) them in half. They're soft, so the dogs can gobble them down quickly and continue their work.
customer_reviews.author: mix579

customer_reviews.title: Bad batch sent to me!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if these treats were bad bc I ordered before and my dogs were fine. But I just gave them to my puppy and 3 year old and one had diarrhea and the other was vomiting. Wtf
customer_reviews.author: shopping addict929

customer_reviews.title: Great cat treats, too!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure it is recommended, but I use these as cat treats and we haven't had any problems. They are the perfect size for cat treats and soft enough that my cats love them. They like all the flavors, but Chicken is their favorite. Amazon seems to have the best price I've found so far. The only downside is that they dry out pretty quickly in the bag, even though it is resealable. I put them in one of those airtight Oxo containers and that seems to prolong their life enough.
customer_reviews.author: GottaLoveBooks

customer_reviews.title: Not the same now
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely NOT the same treats that I purchased back in January. Blue has changed the recipe and my dog just turns her nose up at these now. They don't even smell the same! Will positively not buy ever again. I guess Blue has now placed profit over quality just like all of the other!
customer_reviews.author: DAVID PRITCHARD

customer_reviews.title: Gave my
customer_reviews.text: Got these as treats for my new puppy. I even cut them into smaller pieces. However, any time we gave him some (not an excessive amount because they were cut into smaller pieces) he would have extremely soft stool. As soon as we discontinued the treats, he’s been fine.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Negron

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love 'em, and so do I
customer_reviews.text: These training treats are excellent! They smell great to dogs without being repulsive to humans, and they don't leave an oily mess everywhere. They are the perfect small size for prolonged training with any dog over 30 lbs, and for smaller dogs they are still big enough and easy enough to halve. Since they are soft, breaking them with your fingers is very very easy. These and the other Bits flavors are currently my dogs' go-to everyday reward treats. My absolute preferred training treats are Blue Stix cut into pieces half the size of the indent on the stick, but these are a pretty close second both in use and in value.
customer_reviews.author: Kagetron

customer_reviews.title: Very good treat
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a real tasty treat for my lab pup for her training classes. This works great. She loves them, they are small enough to keep her motivated, but not too big to be feeding her too much quantity (if that makes sense). I can carry a pocket full of these to class and she loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Keith L

customer_reviews.title: My dogs new favorite
customer_reviews.text: I got it first from pupbox (one of those doggie monthly delivery service) and my dogs absolutely loved it. Like they will do any trick for it and it’s the only thing my picky little teacup yorkie would eat (normally she only goes for really meat - chicken/beef and that’s about it). I’m no expert so I don’t know if this is the most healthy treats out there but since my dogs love it so much I now have it on monthly subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S

customer_reviews.title: 9 oz bag of Blue Buffalo Blue Bits received but it expired July 2003
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a 9 oz bag of Blue Buffalo Blue Bits and received it July 2019. When we opened the package we found that the product was disintegrating. Upon checking the expiration date we found that it expired in July 2003. The product was promptly replaced by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Al F.

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves them the bag is basically full of air but besides that it smells okay not chemically they are nice and chewy I tried to upload a video but it would let me but they are puppy approved my older dog loved them as well they are exactly what I was looking for I think I’ll try the salmon one next but this is a must have
customer_reviews.author: ashely

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves these treats
customer_reviews.text: First treats my Puppy every tasted and she loved them. Treats are small but I still break each one in half during training. Went to PetSmart and bought different flavors-they have all been successful. Def. think Amazon sells these treats cheaper than what PetSmart and Petco do.
customer_reviews.author: Maricela O

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!! Made my puppy sick
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this!! I have a 4.5 month old corgi puppy and she got sick from these treats. I don’t know if this was a bad batch or something but we started giving these to our puppy last week. After the first day of giving these to her, she did not have an appetite anymore. She usually loves food! She then started throwing up, multiple times a day. For the next few days, she started having diarrhea. She was acting lethargic and not her peppy self anymore. We stopped feeding her these treats for a day and she got her personality back! She started eating and now finally having solid poops. DO NOT BUY THESE!!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani Quang

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves these treats.
customer_reviews.text: We used these treats to assist with house breaking our puppy. He is now ten months old and has been fully housebroken for months. We still give him a treat after potty breaks outside. In fact, he sits in front of the treat jar as soon as we get back into the house, patiently waiting for his treat.
customer_reviews.author: none

customer_reviews.title: Great treat for puppy training !
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 10 week old English bulldog puppy to help her with training. We are try to couple other brands of treats and she did not like them. She loves these! I like that they’re only 2 1/2 cal per treat they’re soft for her to chew and healthy. Now that we found a treat she really likes it’s making training much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mom life!

customer_reviews.title: Great training treat
customer_reviews.text: This treat is just the right size for training dogs. It's small enough for just 2-3 chews and then you can continue your training exercise. My pup loves this, especially because it's chicken flavored. My hair stylist recommended Blue Buffalo so I'm glad I tried it. She only feeds her dogs Blue Buffalo products.
customer_reviews.author: Aloha87

customer_reviews.title: soft + breakable
customer_reviews.text: Just got a puppy and needed a treat that was healthy and that they loved. Ta-da! Found a winner. These treats are a good size for 1 reward- but we were doing a lot of encouragement training and positive reinforcement so we choose to break 1 treat into 3-4 pieces. They are nice and soft so this was easy to do. one issue is that if you leave the bag unzipped they dry out VERY quick and become quite hard. At that point its harder to break them up because they tend to crumble. very important to keep the bag zipped!! We just ordered more in the salmon flavor and our pup loves those as well!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great size for puppies.
customer_reviews.text: My 12 week old dobie loves these bites. I used them when we trained him. Dk about flavor bc I didn't eat any, but the dog liked them so that's what counts. As he got older he decided he like string cheese better for training so I switched. Good price. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: beverly olds

customer_reviews.title: Treat my Bernese won't even touch
customer_reviews.text: My Bernese likes all treats but for some reason these she hates. She likes her kibble or any nylabone puppy bones we give her but these she looks at me like what again these I told you I don't like them. She won't eat them even when hungry sadly so I guess in the trash they go.
customer_reviews.author: Syanae

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!! 😉
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these soft treats. They are a little bigger than an Altoids mint. My dog likes them so much he tries to make me believe he has to go out side several times a day just so I’ll let him back in to give him a treat. When that wasn’t working, he quit eating his food and just wanted treats. He’s learned they are a treat not substainance. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves them!
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy loves these and will do anything you want when they are out. We try to break them in half or thirds to make them last a little longer. They're a little crumbly when you do that, but that's not a fault of the product. Will be buying again!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Dog Farts from Heck!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fresh, and my dog loves them! They are heart shaped, which is cute. I am giving 4 stars instead of 5, because they give my dog toxic smelling gas. Even 1 treat causes him to let out farts that smell as if something has died inside of him. 😆
customer_reviews.author: Aly Katastrophe

customer_reviews.title: Only half full
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting smaller treats and more of them. Good quality, but the value isn't what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Sdbic

customer_reviews.title: Cute and healthy
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying the beef and chicken varieties of these treats for a couple years now. I love how they're heart shaped and easy to break into smaller pieces. My dogs love them too! I think they are helping their coats with the omegas included.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Really good sized treats
customer_reviews.text: These treats smell really good and are a good size as you can break the hearts in half and have double the treats. We are training a very bull-headed 14 month old puppy and he loves these. We can keep his interest with these treats through the entire training session. I will be buying more of these.
customer_reviews.author: I Feel the Need, the Need to Read book blog

customer_reviews.title: Doggy loves them
customer_reviews.text: My puppy goes crazy for these! I was able to teach my puppy how to sit with these treats. However, I recently read bad news about the Blue brand regarding the ingredients they use. I will have to look into this matter and see how bad the situation is....So after my puppy finishes this bag I will have to reconsider buying another bag.
customer_reviews.author: escarTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Good For Training
customer_reviews.text: These are tiny 1/4 inch bits. Dog loves them but their so small she (Westhighland White Terrier) swallows them whole without chewing. I would use these for training a puppy instead of a chew treat for an adult dog. Great aroma.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Cruzin

customer_reviews.title: Blue Buffalo BLUE Bits Natural Soft-Moist Training Dog Treats
customer_reviews.text: My Dog's New Favorite Treat/Snack only takes 2 & he knows after he eats he will get 2.. he loves em.. Beef is all we buy him.. Blue Buffalo we can trust what they are made from.. arrived in great shape nothing damaged or missing.. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Wandakay

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product to train my dog. I gave the individual ratings 5 stars not because of what I think, but because my dog loves them. He responds to these treats immediately versus the other treats that I tried. I cannot ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: Kram

customer_reviews.title: Will dry out quickly
customer_reviews.text: Finally found a dog training treat that our extremely picky dog would eat and did not upset his stomach. Dog is a large to very large breed. Unfortunately the bag doesn’t re-seal (marketed with a resealable top) well and these dried out and dog refuses them now.
customer_reviews.author: K. M. Evaul

customer_reviews.title: mold growing on treats
customer_reviews.text: Dog was refusing these when I realized there’s mold growing on the treats despite the expiration date being 6 month away and the treat having been stored in the utility closet (cool, dry). Previously purchased these treat and did not have this issue. Dogs enjoyed them when they weren’t moldy. 🤷🏻‍♂️
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought these treats for my 2 year old pitbull, I carry them in a small bag when I take him for a walk. They are soft like gummy bears. The only thing I don't like is that they are coated in some brown substance and it flakes off. I bought these soft treats because other hard treats tend to leave crumbs.
customer_reviews.author: mrtza

customer_reviews.title: I think these are sized for Training Purposes
customer_reviews.text: My furbabies (2dogs and 4cats) like these treats which makes me very happy but the peices are so small. I think these treats are only for training purposes. When I gave them the treat, they looked at me and said what's this, are we broke, did we run outta money, where's the rest of the treat. I agree with them where's the rest of the treat?? I mean this tiny little bag costs $9. I saw that it is Blue Buffalo Chicken Bits but I thought the Bits were bigger than what was in the bag. I love Blue products for my babies but I won't be buying these Bits again cause they are too expensive
customer_reviews.author: BoolynnlooTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Heavy smoke smell
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy "smoked" smell to these treats. My dogs eat them, but not enthusiastically. The smoked flavor I suppose is added to appeal to humans but I find it obnoxiously strong. Wild canines do not have smoke houses, as best I know. Their domesticated cousins don't need "flavor enhancement" in their food that may be carcinogenic.
customer_reviews.author: Nonna

customer_reviews.title: Our puppy didn't like it. I
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy didn't like it. I;d recommend instead Stella & Chewy's Meal Mixers . our puppy thinks that is crack and will lick our hands raw. These bits? she ignores. And these were the first ones we gave her, so not like she was used to other brands.
customer_reviews.author: FL Guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome treats!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for healthier options of dog treats for my puppy (4 months) and I found these at Petsmart. They were too expensive at Petsmart so I ordered them here on Amazon. They are the perfect size for my puppy and soft so they are easy for her to chew with her little baby teeth. They smell pretty good and my puppy loves the way they taste. Work great for training your puppy!
customer_reviews.author: DaraLovesCoupons

customer_reviews.title: My pup loves these treats.
customer_reviews.text: I have a micro goldendoodle, which are notoriously easy to train. He's smart and catches on quickly, but these treats make the learning process smooth and easy. He is 6 months and understands a full list of commands.
customer_reviews.author: SarahA

customer_reviews.title: Great for training!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a starter pack to see if my puppy will like them and it turns out he couldn’t get enough of them. This is the best treat we used to train him to go into his crate and we will give him 1 to go in, then 2 more after we locked the crate. Now I paid for this bigger pack and will keep using it to train my puppy.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these!! We have a 40 pound boxer and a 75 pound boxer mastiff mix and they both think these are the best thing ever. They both have sensitive stomachs and we have allergens in our house we have to avoid and these fit both bills. These work great as small incentives and training treats. It has worked wonders for getting our boxer in her crate at night.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Paws down, doggy approved.
customer_reviews.text: As long as it's healthy and she likes it, that's all that matters. Although these are training treats, I mostly just use them as bribery to get her to cuddle with me instead of my husband. It's works pretty good. He can't figure out why she's been following me around instead of him lately, it's great. Shhh our secret.
customer_reviews.author: ShaynaO

customer_reviews.title: I work at an animal shelter and all dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: I work at an animal shelter and all the dogs I work with love them. Even my fussy Chihuahua loves them! I’m so happy. In the past I’ve purchased so many different treats only to find out my dog wouldn’t like them. These are great and it’s a brand I trust.
customer_reviews.author: L.L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for puppies too!
customer_reviews.text: I thought the treats were hard at the begining for my puppy. But it was fine. It's not soft but not that hard either. He chews it easier, even my cat likes how they smell. I gave him one to try and he ate it with no problem. And now my puppy climbs up the stairs and waits for me to give him one of these, he's hooked on them.
customer_reviews.author: Radwa Aziz

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed these treats are advertised as soft. I received them yesterday and opened them to find them dry and hard. My puppy has a hard time chewing them at 10 weeks old Update after 3 treats my puppy was throwing up. I will never buy again. They went straight to the garbage
customer_reviews.author: HILLARY WATERS

customer_reviews.title: Super dry and bad smelling treats
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the treats I bought this is my least favorite! These treats dry out very easily which made it difficult for my puppy to chew on it. After a few training sessions she lost the motivation to train further as she was not enjoying the treats. They also smell really bad. Would not recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Mallika Dayani

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money, dogs love these.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't rate the flavor because...my dog can't talk and I don't eat these! But he loves them! Great value for sure when you look at the regular size bags you get at the store, and compare with this big bag.
customer_reviews.author: Lovehoseandshoes

customer_reviews.title: Great price and great training treats.
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price on Amazon. I recently purchased a bag at the local store and paid twice as much for these and was ticked off! I should have ordered them on here! My chiweenie loves these and turns her nose up to other treats that are similar in size and label. I believe the blue buffalo brand is the best.
customer_reviews.author: B TERRILL

customer_reviews.title: working out well
customer_reviews.text: they're about the size of a dime or penny. for training purposes, i have broken a bunch of them down into threes to use for training. the smaller size is a lot more adequate for training sessions. my dog likes them.
customer_reviews.author: ngvaynshtok

customer_reviews.title: great mini training treats for pups of all ages
customer_reviews.text: We use these for our 1 year old puppy who is still practicing all of his tricks. We keep a handful in our pockets pretty much everywhere we go with him in case a training opportunity presents itself. They stay moist as long as you keep the bag closed securely.
customer_reviews.author: Bittersweet Britknee

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Smells good and my dogs love them. I used Them when I was house training them and it worked well. House trained a golden retriever in two months and a Maltese/shitzu mix in three months.
customer_reviews.author: phyllis

customer_reviews.title: My dog LOVES it
customer_reviews.text: First time trying these, and my dog LOVES them. He gets excited anytime he hears me shaking the bag. If your dog has a potato allergy, these aren't a good choice, since it contains potato. I'm happy the first ingredient is deboned chicken. I'd rather dog treats contain as few ingredients as possible. Dogs should be fed healthy food too. Reasonable price for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: AineadeleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Pup loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 month old frenchie and was so cautious on what i should get him as a training treat. We had biscuits that was given to us and my pup couldn't even break it! These bits are perfect and what I love the most is that its soft and SMALL! But you I can still break it into 3 pieces! I did my research for my frenchie, and in this article it listed the best treats for them and this was one of them, I'm very happy with it and definitely will buy more.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great training treats
customer_reviews.text: Bizzy enjoys meaty treats he will retrieve the ball and do tricks 10 times in a row LOL which is out of the ordinary. They were a little on the dry side but nothing a little water can Not help
customer_reviews.author: Treena

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love em
customer_reviews.text: but they are so tiny, you end up giving even a small dog several. I don't have a dog so I don't use them for training (other than training my friends' dogs to love me) but I can see their value in that.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Stanek

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them
customer_reviews.text: Love these for my puppy! We potty trained him and used these as treats. He finds them delicious and is always looking for more. Great treat for your dog and perfect to use for training and obedience as well!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Scheffel

product_meta.title: Blue Buffalo BLUE Bits Natural Soft-Moist Training Dog Treats
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Chicken Bits| Size:16 ozBLUE Bits are dog training treats that are soft, moist and extremely tasty. Perfect for training and perfect for treating, BLUE Bits are a healthy and nutritious reward that your dog will love.
feature_bullets: REAL CHICKEN FIRST: BLUE Bits dog training treats are made with delicious real chicken as the first ingredient making them an ideal reward for your best friend’s best behavior.

MEATY TRAINING TREATS: For dogs that love a meaty treat, BLUE Bits are tender, bite-sized morsels that are the perfect size for training. Plus with DHA to help support cognitive development, they’re an ideal puppy treat.

WHOLESOME INGREDIENTS: These dog treats don’t contain any chicken (or poultry) by-product meals and are free from corn, wheat and soy. Plus, they’re free from artificial preservatives like propylene glycol and colors like red dye 40.
HEALTHY DOG TREATS: Blue Buffalo natural dog treats feature the healthy, wholesome ingredients you’ll love feeding as much as they’ll love eating.
Contains (1) 16-oz bag of BLUE Bits Natural Soft-Moist Training Dog Treats, Chicken Recipe
